items.question: Which of the following should you do to stay safe during kayaking?

answers.answer: Check the weather condition before the start of the activity
Look out for strong winds, waves, rocks and reefs

items.question: The warning signs at the river, reservoir, park or beach, tell us about the ___________________________.
Which of the following lists the dangers in open water?

answers.answer: Watercraft such as boats and jet skis

items.question: Which of the following is NOT a correct way of getting into a swimming pool safely?

answers.answer: Diving into the water without checking the depth of the water
Sitting on the edge facing the water and lowering your body into it feet first

items.question: Which of the following guidelines should you observe when you are the beach?

answers.answer: Swim between the red and yellow flags
Put on proper swim wear before swimming

items.question: If you are unable to see the bottom of a river, reservoir, stream or quarry, which of the following lists some of the dangers there?

answers.answer: No danger since nothing can be seen
Underwater objects, rocks, weeds, muddy bottom, and unknown depth

items.question: Everyone on board a watercraft should wear a Personal Floatation Device (PFD).
Which of the following should a child do when he sees an uncovered bucket full of water in the toilet?

answers.answer: Get an adult to empty the bucket
Pour half of the water into another bucket and get an adult to empty the bucket

items.question: Which of the following is a way of checking the strength of a river current?

answers.answer: Jumping into the river to feel its current
Leaning forward from the bank of the river and using one hand to feel its current
Throwing in a stick and seeing how quickly it flows down the river

items.question: Which of the following should you NOT do at the beach?
Which of the following is where you can find out more about the rules at a swimming pool?

answers.answer: The signs around the pool area
The safety symbols along the poolside

items.question: A good swimmer does not need to wear a Personal Floatation device (PFD) during a watercraft activity.
Which of the following is a tip for staying safe at the beach?

answers.answer: Swim at a beach with lifeguards
Read and obey warning signs before entering the water
Always swim under the supervision of a responsible adult

items.question: At a condominium pool with no lifeguards on duty, someone is struggling in the water. Which of the following is the most suitable person to approach for help?
Which of the following should you NOT do before entering the pool?
Which of the following weather conditions should you be avoided for outdoor swimming?

answers.answer: A clear day with a lightning risk alert

items.question: It is always safe to dive into the river or sea because open water is deeper than a swimming pool.
Which of the following is where you should swim at a designated beach?

answers.answer: In between the red and yellow flags

items.question: An eight year old boy was invited for a swim at the pool. Should he inform his parents?

answers.answer: Yes, he should inform his parents and ask them for permission
No, he should be able to swim without adult supervision

items.question: Which of the following should you NOT do when you visit a beach, lake or river overseas?

answers.answer: Ask a local if you are unsure of the current conditions
Only participate in activities such as swimming and canoeing in designated recreational areas
Scan carefully for obstacles and other potential dangers before you consider entering the water safely

items.question: Which of the following should you look out for when you are on board a boat or cruise ship?

answers.answer: The nearest exit from your location
The location of the life jacket
The safety booklet of the boat or cruise ship

items.question: Which of the following is a possible danger at a canal after a storm?
Which of the following is the most suitable person to approach for assistance at the pool?
Which of the following items in and around the home may pose a danger to a child?

answers.answer: A large fish tank filled with water
A large bucket filled with water

items.question: You and your friends come across a canal on your way home. The water in the canal is not deep. Which of the following should you do?

answers.answer: Go down into the canal to play
Throw stones and pebbles into the canal
Encourage my friends to climb into the canal to play

items.question: Which of the following is most likely to cause an accident at the pool?

answers.answer: Climbing down the pool ladder to enter the water
Running around the pool playing with one of your friends
Diving into a deep pool under your instructor's supervision
Following the instructions of the lifeguard and your instructor

items.question: Which of the following should you do to protect yourself against harmful ultraviolet (UV) rays?

answers.answer: Avoid the strongest rays of the day

items.question: You should not swim when you feel unwell.
You should reapply sunscreen every two hours during water activities.
You are swimming for more than an hour. Which of the following states how often you should drink to stay hydrated?

answers.answer: Before, during, and after the session
Not necessary to hydrate since you are in the water

items.question: You should not swim if you have an open wound on your body.
If you have a medical condition such as asthma or a heart problem, which of the following must you do when you are swimming at a public pool?

answers.answer: Swim as long as you feel fine
Swim as long as you have taken your medication
Inform the lifeguard about your condition

items.question: Avoid the sun between _____________________ when the ultraviolet index is the highest.
If you vomit in the pool or see someone who has vomited in the pool, which of the following must you do?

answers.answer: Alert the lifeguard or pool staff immediately
Ignore the vomitus and continue swimming

items.question: You will still get dehydrated during swimming because your body will perspire in the water.
You should not ___________________ in the swimming pool.
Which of the following is a benefit of swimming?
Which of the following should you do when using sunscreen?

answers.answer: Use sunscreen with an SPF of 30 or higher
Reapply often and especially during prolonged activities in the water

sections.label: Principles of Personal Safety and Survival

items.question: A child can swim alone if he or she has taken swimming lessons.
The Personal Floatation Device (PFD) is used to keep a conscious person afloat.
When you are thrown off a boat without a Personal Floatation Device (PFD), you can use your clothing to make a float for survival.
You should wear a Personal Floatation Device (PFD) when canoeing.
Which of the following is part of the Water Smart Code?
Before diving into the pool, you must ensure that _____________________.

answers.answer: the water is clear and deep
the water is clear and shallow

items.question: Which of the following activities requires you to put on a Personal Floatation Device (PFD)?
In case of emergency in the water, which of the following numbers should you call?
Which of the following should you do if you experience cramp in the water?

answers.answer: Pull and hold on the nearest person to you
Relax, roll onto your back, and wave for help with one arm

items.question: If someone needs help in the water, you should ____________________.

answers.answer: watch from the side and do nothing
jump in immediately to save the person
throw an object that can float to the person

items.question: Which of the following is a sign of dehydration?
Which of the following is a distress signal?

answers.answer: Immersing your head in the water
Waving your arms and shouting for help

items.question: If you drifted out to the ocean alone, which of the following should you do?

answers.answer: Stay calm and do not panic
Hold anything that will help you float
Look out and listen for any incoming aircraft or ships, and draw their attention by splashing around in the water and waving and shouting for help

items.question: One of the reasons why someone needs to swim underwater is to find an object.
Which of the following describes the Heat Escape Lessening Posture (H.E.L.P.)?

answers.answer: It is a technique used when performing a rescue
It is a technique used when wearing a Personal Floatation Device (PFD)
It is a position used to call for help easily
It is a position used to save energy and prevent heat loss in a cold water immersion

items.question: If you were to fall off a boat in the ocean fully clothed without a Personal Floatation Device (PFD), which of the following should you do?

answers.answer: Remove heavy items of clothing that is heavy
Leave on a layer of clothing to minimise heat loss
Inflate your pants or shirt/jacket to use as a floatation aid

items.question: In a deep water emergency situation, you should remove items of clothing that are too heavy.
If you were swept out by a current, which of the following should you do to retain body heat?

answers.answer: Avoid immersing your head in the water
Adopt the Heat Escape Lessening Posture (H.E.L.P.)

items.question: Which of the following should you do if you were caught in a fast-flowing river?

answers.answer: Remain calm and swim against the current
Remain calm and try to float feet first in a half-sitting position

items.question: If you were swept out by a current, which of the following should you do to save energy?

answers.answer: Keep your arms out of the water
Hold anything that will help you float

items.question: Which of the following stroke can be used to save energy in a deep water emergency?
Treading water is a survival technique in a deep water survival situation.
Which of the following should you do when performing survival swimming?

answers.answer: Adopt the Heat Escape Lessening Posture (H.E.L.P) or huddle position
Remain calm, breathe regularly and swim with slow relaxed strokes
Change position and stroke to save energy and avoid overusing your muscles

items.question: If you are not confident to rescue someone in trouble in the water, which of the following should you do?

answers.answer: Use a mobile phone to contact a friend for help
Walk away quietly as you are not confident
Perform the rescue even though you are not confident
Alert a lifeguard or an adult passer-by for help or call 995 for assistance

items.question: Which of the following shows the correct sequence of the four As in any rescue?
Which of the following describes a non-swimmer victim?

answers.answer: May submerge for periods of time
Assumes a vertical position in the water
Struggles desperately with grabbing and climbing actions

items.question: An unconscious victim may be facing up or down in the water and is not moving.
One of the four As in rescue is ____________________.
Which of the following can be used to perform a throw rescue?
Which of the following is a situation for using a talk rescue?

answers.answer: When the person is close enough to the rescuer
When the person is capable of responding to instructions

items.question: If you cannot swim, which of the following rescue techniques should you use?
A child should inform a lifeguard immediately when he or she sees someone struggling in the pool.
Which of the following is a dry rescue technique?
